forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle before 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a soft veil of clouds clings to the edges of the city, hinting at the remnants of last night's drizzle. While the chill still lingers in the air with a temperature hovering around fifty-four degrees, the sun is poised to wrestle its way through the clouds, promising glimpses of brighter skies. The forecast foretells a day that begins with a chance of drizzle into the early afternoon, before transforming into a partly sunny atmosphere. Winds will whisper through the city, gusting at times but remaining gentle, a reminder of the bay’s ever-watchful presence.

For those venturing out, it’s wise to don layers — a light jacket will serve well against the early coolness, but consider shedding it later as the warmth of the sun brings life to the streets. With the marine layer still teasing the coast, the Golden Gate Bridge should remain a silhouette against the horizon, inviting a stroll to take in its majestic form. The day, though not perfectly clear, offers plenty of opportunities for quiet exploration — a visit to a local café with a good book or a leisurely walk through the parks will yield moments of serene beauty amid the bustling city. Engage with the charm of this constantly shifting landscape, where each element contributes to the day’s unique character.
